title.narrative: Multi-sector (WASH, Child Protection) Emergency Response for Most Vulnerable Population affected by the earthquake in Haiti

description.narrative:
The aim of the proposed UNICEF engagements under the CERF RR allocation is to support the emergency response work of government partners and local and international NGOs already operating in the three departments most affected by the 14 August earthquake (Nippes, South, Grand’Anse), with a focus on WASH and Child Protection.
UNICEF support access to safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene facilities and services to respond to the urgent needs of the affected population, including a focus on WASH in health institutions and schools. Activities to improve access to safe drinking water include (and are not limited to) the provision and installation of bladders and water treatment units, water trucking during the first 3 months, the rehabilitation works of severely damaged water systems and the provision of household water treatment products (water purifiers and water flocculants).
Case management and psychosocial support remain an essential need to be addressed immediately in the first weeks in order to promptly protect children and ensure their recovery. UNICEF are closely coordinating and supporting national institutions namely the Institut pour le Bien Etre Sociale et la Recherche (IBSR)– the national agency in charge of child protection -, the Office de la Protection du Citoyen (OPC) and the Brigade de la Protection des Mineures (BPM) to ensure proper provision of essential psychosocial support and protection to children in need.
The project targets 100,000 affected people with its WASH engagement and 31,000 affected people with its Protection (CP) engagement.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS HAITI RAPID RESPONSE EARTHQUAKE 2021

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Provide case management and psychological support to affected children
CP.1 Number of unaccompanied or separated children identified and assisted, including family tracing and reunification
Number of children receiving psychosocial support
Number of girls, boys and adolescents who received GBV prevention messages and GBV related information

Vulnerable population, health centres and schools affected by the earthquake in the departments of Grande Anse, Nippes and Sud have access to WASH facilities, supplies and services to satisfy their urgent needs
Number of schools equipped with 3 handwashing facilities and critical hygiene supplies (soap, bleach, waste containers...)

SP.1b Number of people benefiting from menstrual hygiene management kits and/or dignity kits (Number of individuals assisted with hygiene kits, calculated from the number of households benefiting from hygiene kits, including soap and dignity hygiene items for women and girls )
WS.3 Number of WASH (e.g. latrines) structures constructed or rehabilitated that offer privacy for women and girls (latrines)
WS.6 Number of people accessing a sufficient quantity of safe water as per agreed sector/cluster coordination standards and norms
